Job Description

Associate Director, PDT FP&A

Cambridge, MA

OBJECTIVES/PURPOSE

  • Support development and execution of financial strategy for Takeda Plasma Derived Therapies (PDT) by conducting financial analysis and shaping financial story and presentations.
  • Interact with key stakeholders across PDT value chain (strategy, R&D, plasma collection, manufacturing, operations, marketing, and sales) to ensure understanding and alignment on financial drivers and messaging.
  • Assist with the financial consolidation reporting and planning processes for the Global Plasma-Derived Therapies businesses.
  • Key role in preparation of PDT financial forecasts and reporting (consolidate financial analysis, develop presentation materials, contribute to messaging / storyline flow)

ACCOUNTABILITIES

  • Support building storyline and messaging around financial data to communicate clear and consistent performance picture internally and externally.
  • Interact with key stakeholders across PDT value chain (strategy, R&D, plasma collection, manufacturing, operations, marketing, and sales) to ensure understanding of financial drivers and alignment on financial strategy and messaging.
  • Consolidate PDT Global P&L and business partner with relevant stakeholders to understand key performance drivers.
  • Provide business finance partnership support to PDT management team on topics related to current business optimization, strategic and business development projects, preparation of financial budgets and forecasts.
  • Support and challenge commercial and functional stakeholders during preparation and reviews of PDT Mid-Range Plan (MRP), Long Range Forecast (LRF), and Mid-Year Commitment (MYC).
  • Lead consolidation efforts of presentation materials and participate in story development / BU messaging for major financial forecasts (MRP, LRF, MYC)
  • Oversee concise and well-thought-out financial presentations for Plan/Update reviews with senior management.
  • Develop and actively communicate all relevant, reliable, and insightful information / analysis to key business partners.
  • Manage the process and timelines for the ad-hoc typed analysis.
  • Other additional duties and responsibilities as assigned.

DIMENSIONS AND ASPECTS

Technical/Functional (Line) Expertise

  • Strong data analysis skills and ability to illustrate / simplify key business insights.
  • Proficiency in MS PowerPoint and/or other presentation tools.
  • Good knowledge of MS Excel.

Leadership

  • Peer and cross functional leadership skills, ability to manage team discussions, present and defend team decisions, and manage expectations with stakeholders.

Decision-making and Autonomy

  • Self-starter, forward-thinker, and problem-solver, ability to take ownership over assigned tasks.

Interaction

  • Good communication and interpersonal skills. Ability to build and reinforce relationship with multiple stakeholders in a matrix organization.

Innovation

  • Quick learner, able to think strategically and challenge status quo.

Complexity

Ability to understand, simplify, and communicate complex processes and concepts.

EDUCATION, BEHAVIOURAL COMPETENCIES AND SKILLS:

  • Min. 5-7 years of work experience in a multinational company.
  • Biotech / Pharma / Plasma industry experience is preferable.
  • Finance background is preferred, however candidates with other functional experience (consultancy, strategy, marketing) are welcome.
  • Min. Finance/Business Bachelor’s degree, master’s degree preferred.

Job Title: Patient Services & Field Reimbursement Lead, US Oncology
Job Description:
Job Description

About the role:

As a member of Takeda Oncology, as a Director, your work will contribute to our bold, inspiring vision: We aspire to cure cancer. Here, you'll build a career grounded in purpose and be empowered to deliver your best. As part of the US Patient Value & Access  team, you will report to Head of Access Marketing and partner with Medical, Sales, Marketing, Advocacy, Policy, Legal, and Ethics and Compliance.

How you will contribute:

  • Oversee the development and design of a fit-for-purpose patient services and access solutions model for all Takeda Oncology products. This includes the modernization of the OBU PS programs and Field Reimbursement.

  • Oversee the generation of customer insights, conduct service gap analyses and the design of new patient access and support programs

  • Oversee appropriate collaboration with Takeda partners including but not limited to: Medical, Sales, Marketing, Advocacy, Policy, Legal and Ethics & Compliance to understand brand value drivers and key business challenges to optimize scope of services and delivery model.

  • Responsible for staying current in the industry by consistently benchmarking across competitive companies to ensure strategies and services are best-in-class for Oncology.

  • Oversee the evolution of fit for purpose models for in line and newly launched products to support the unmet needs of patients and appropriate education of HCP offices

  • Oversee field reimbursement team, develop competency model and specialized training for development of team and enhanced execution.

  • Oversee the design, implementation, and ongoing management of all patient reimbursement HUB services programs.

  • Oversee the development of insights and analytics tools to appropriately inform the business.

  • Oversee the development and adherence to SOPs and business rules related to all Takeda Oncology US patient support.

  • Oversee the annual brand planning process with data driven reimbursement insights.

  • Ensure controls are established to confirm that vendor partners are performing their duties in accordance with Takeda policies and monitor adherence.

  • Demonstrate fiscal discipline and accountability to budget guidelines.

  • Partner with Ethics and Compliance to ensure balance between stable structures, governance, processes, and systems, and dynamic approaches to delivering innovative patient access and support solutions and appropriately manage risks.

  • Lead the Field Reimbursement Director team by establishing objectives, providing training & coaching, and performance management for the field team.

  • Provide strategic customer insights from the field team to the PVA LT and brand teams

  • Active member of PVA leadership team.

Travel requirement

  • 30-40% domestic travel

Minimum Requirements/Qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s degree required. MBA preferred.

  • Requires 10+ years of experience within the biotech/specialty pharmaceutical/pharmaceutical industry.

  • At least 5+ years of proven experience leading Patient Services call center HUB operations

  • 5+ years People leadership

  • Excellent analytical (qualitative and quantitative), strategic thinking, creativity, and problem-solving skills.

  • Ability to influence senior management with accountability for decision making

  • Self-directed, hands-on approach, comfortable with broad and varied job responsibilities.

  • Comfortable functioning with ambiguity. Mentoring / leadership ability.

  • Oncology/Specialty launch experience. Ideally with both oral and injectable products.

  • Record of accomplishment of successfully managing and leading vendor relationships from both a strategic and operational perspective and achieving results.

  • In-depth knowledge of pharmaceutical manufacturer compliance requirements, patient confidentiality (HIPAA regulations), product reimbursement and product access.

  • Knowledge and experience in Medicare Parts A, B, D, Medicaid, and private payer policies, reimbursement process, health policy, areas of coverage, payment, coding, Specialty Pharmacy, and buy and bill.

  • Experience with Commercial Brand Planning process, able to translate brand disease state and business drivers into patient support programs and operational requirements.

  • “Customer First” customer service orientation. Puts the customer at the center of all business activities.

Job Description

About the role:

Join Takeda as a Director, Data Acquisition where you will play a crucial role in driving and navigating transformative initiatives while fostering a culture of continuous improvement, adaptability, and growth. You will also be expected to lead a team that includes leads for important external data domains such as licensed, specialty, and omnichannel data and ensuring those teams elevate the partnership with suppliers in each of those categories. As part of the Commercial Data Management & Strategy (CDMS) team, you will report to Head of U.S. Commercial Data Management & Strategy and partner with Business Unit (BU), Sales Operations, and Data Digital & Technology (DD&T) colleagues, as well as, external stakeholders.

How you will contribute:

  • Partner with an extensive network of external data suppliers to understand the data marketplace, to optimize spends, to leverage the breadth of data, and to build expertise.

  • Engage with stakeholders to enable business strategies and provide thought leadership on opportunities where external data partners and capabilities play an important role.

  • Provide data product/domain leadership and develop roadmaps and strategic plans to articulate the vision.

  • Partner with DD&T in concert with the data acquisition domain leads on their team as the expert and senior conduit to the data vendors to initiate new action as well as to remediate and resolve challenges.

  • Knowledgeable of USBU procured data and build enterprise data awareness of capabilities and opportunities.

  • Responsible for the data vendor relationships and overall quality of data delivery to Takeda.

  • Build and sustain important relationships with Procurement to ensure cost efficiency and accuracy in all contracts.  Support RFPs and contract negotiations. Ensures team and related CDMS staff capture comprehensive documentation.

  • Works to ensure value of data sourced from the external community is realized and communicated within the organization.

  • As a member of the CDMS leadership team, spearhead initiatives to foster a cohesive and inclusive environment, emphasizing collaboration and shared goals.

  • Partner closely with stakeholders, particularly in sales operations, to align strategies, improve communication channels, and enhance cross-functional cooperation.

  • Drive cultural improvements within the team, managing change effectively while cultivating a culture of transparency and continuous improvement.

  • Champion the enhancement of data literacy among team members, facilitating knowledge-sharing and leveraging data-driven decision-making.

  • Actively pursue ways to cultivate a learning culture, encouraging ongoing skill development to propel the team’s growth and success.

  • Lead in the development and execution of data quality and service level enforcement techniques applied at the contractual layer by incorporating and advancing best practices.

  • Oversee of a calendar of regularly scheduled and cyclical supplier reviews to ensure consistent compliance.

  • Minimum BS/BA degree with MS/MBA preferred.

  • Minimum of 10 years’ experience in the pharmaceutical, immunology, biologic/biotech, or medical device industries.

  • Minimum of 8 years of people leadership experience leading a medium to large organization and influencing senior-level management and key stakeholders.

  • Proven track record of driving business process transformation and organizational culture change as well as delivering on programs with complex business deliverables.

  • Ability to set priorities, deliver on deadlines and develop workflow processes and tasks in an evolving, dynamic marketplace.

  • Strong analytical skills and budget management.

  • Previous organizational change management experience.

  • Excellent interpersonal, communication, and skills necessary to lead through change and influence without authority.

  • Ability to demonstrate strategic and critical thinking, as well as problem solving skills.

  • Strong organizational, planning and project management skills–ability to set priorities, meet deadlines and develop workflow processes and tasks for multiple projects.

  • Track record of successful leadership, management, and development of small to medium, multi-disciplinary dispersed teams. Strong judge of talent with the ability to make tough talent decisions.

  • Health care business acumen with a comprehensive understanding of the pharmaceutical industry.

Job Description

About the role:

As a member of Takeda Oncology, as a Senior Manager, your work will contribute to our bold, inspiring vision: We aspire to cure cancer. Here, you'll build a career grounded in purpose and be empowered to deliver your best. As part of the US Oncology Marketing team, you will report to Head of Marketing, US Oncology, and partner with Sales, Legal, Integrated Brands, Patients Values & Access, Customer Experience and Insights, Ethics and Compliance, and external partners.

How you will contribute:

  • Develop, own and execute initiatives aligned with the US Oncology Strategy, brand strategy and deliver tactics for both Health Care Providers (HCP) and patient audiences.

  • Manage outside agencies and consultants to meet expected project objectives and hold them accountable to agreed upon standards.

Job Description:
Job Description

About the role:

Join Takeda as a Director, External Data Governance & Execution where you will play a crucial role in driving and navigating transformative initiatives while fostering a culture of continuous improvement, adaptability, and growth. You will also play a vital role in this mission by overseeing and managing the performance and delivery of the data vendor community, coordinating on the approach to data ingestion in concert with Data, Digital and technology (DD&T), and managing the book of business and all related documentation. The Director of External Data Governance & Execution comprehensively manages the rules and processes that define the provisioning of externally sourced data both in regards to the responsibilities of the suppliers upstream from Takeda as well as how it is delivered to corporate system. As part of the Commercial Data Management & Strategy (CDMS), you will report to Head of U.S. Commercial Data Management & Strategy and partner with Business Unit (BU), Master Data, Sales Operations, and DD&T colleagues, as well as external partners.

How you will contribute:

  • Partner with an extensive network of external data suppliers to oversee and take accountability for the delivery of high quality data to ensure that performance measures up to or exceeds contracted service level agreements.

  • Engage with stakeholders to enable business strategies and provide thought leadership on opportunities where external data partners and capabilities play an important role.

  • Provide data governance and execution leadership and develop roadmaps and strategic plans to articulate the vision.

  • Partner with DD&T in concert with the data acquisition and master data domain leads as the expert and senior conduit to the technical partners within data vendors to initiate new action as well as to remediate and resolve challenges.

  • Knowledgeable of USBU procured data and build enterprise data awareness of capabilities and opportunities.

  • Partner closely with stakeholders, particularly in sales operations, to align strategies, improve communication channels, and enhance cross-functional cooperation.

  • Drive cultural improvements within the team and manage change effectively while cultivating a culture of transparency and continuous improvement

  • Champion the enhancement of data literacy among team members, facilitating knowledge-sharing and leveraging data-driven decision-making.

  • Actively pursue ways to cultivate a learning culture, encouraging ongoing skill development to propel the team’s growth and success.

  • Enable the USBU to acquire and continually improve advanced data capabilities, provide high quality data, deliver operational excellence, and empower greater adoption through education.

  • Orchestrate and oversee compliant processes and policies for the intake of externally sourced data.

  • Liaise with privacy/ethics/compliance to ensure adherence to Takeda standards and related governance expectations.

  • Own and manage the business rules and related governance tasks applied to sourced data by the supplier community.

  • Provide comprehensive documentation on all data partners and ensures it remains up to date and accessible.

  • Manage the contractual book of business and all aspects of the contract lifecycle in partnership with Finance and Procurement, playing a leadership role in cyclical activities such as MRP and MYC.

  • Monitor and control all supplier-based project activities and actively coordinate with BU, DD&T, COBS, and Vendor-based team leads to ensure performance and delivery meet contracted expectations.

  • Provide data investigation case management and tracking for complex and escalated matters requiring cross-functional teamwork and research across the USBU.

  • Ensure operational excellence across the data delivery and ingestion aspects of the data supply chain.

  • Partner with BU, DD&T, and Vendor colleagues throughout the data and software development cycle and into operational components to ensure all parties are aligned and working towards Takeda’s strategic and tactical objectives.

Minimum Requirements/Qualifications:

  • Minimum BS/BA degree with MS/MBA preferred

  • Minimum of 10 years’ experience in the pharmaceutical, immunology, biologic/biotech, or medical device industries.

  • Minimum of 8 years of people leadership experience leading a medium to large organization and influencing senior-level management and key stakeholders

  • Proven track record of driving business process transformation and organizational culture change as well as delivering on programs with complex business deliverables

  • Ability to set priorities, deliver on deadlines and develop workflow processes and tasks in an evolving, dynamic marketplace.

  • Strong analytical skills and budget management.

  • Previous organizational change management experience

  • Excellent interpersonal, communication, and skills necessary to lead through change and influence without authority.

  • Ability to demonstrate strategic and critical thinking, as well as problem solving skills

  • Strong organizational, planning and project management skills–ability to set priorities, meet deadlines and develop workflow processes and tasks for multiple projects

  • Track record of successful leadership, management, and development of small to medium, multi-disciplinary dispersed teams. Strong judge of talent with the ability to make tough talent decisions.

  • Health care business acumen with a comprehensive understanding of the pharmaceutical industry

Job Title: Director, US Medical – Digital Capability Lead (Analytics & Insights)
Job Description:
Job Description

Director, Digital Capability Lead (DCL), Analytics & Insights, US Medical

About the role:

Join Takeda as a Director, Digital Capability Lead (DCL), Analytics & Insights, in the US Medical team, where you will establish and manage the strategy, execution, and evolution of US Medical’s ‘Analytics & Insights’ systems and processes that are essential to data-driven decision-making. As part of the US Medical Team, you will report to Senior Director, Medical Digital Engagement and work alongside other verticals and omnichannel engagement leads balancing US Medical ecosystem priorities and stakeholder input.

How you will contribute:

Ownership of Current Capabilities & Needs Mapping

  • Understand systems and resultant data, metrics, and KPIs within the US medical omnichannel ecosystem that can be leveraged to inform medical strategy and HCP engagement.

  • Develop a framework that clearly articulates the path from data bricks to metrics through to actions that can drive effective US HCP scientific engagement. This includes creating a definition of an insight and an ensuing framework that supports high-science engagements throughout our ecosystem and a feedback loop.

  • Identify gaps in the framework and develop an analytics and insights roadmap to continue to evolve the capabilities within US Medical.

  • Evaluate and evolve US Medical’s data lake, data connectors, and cleanliness aligned with Takeda’s and industry best practices.

  • Develop a consistent, accessible, and user-friendly data visualization portal, aligned with Takeda’s standard and communication framework to enable access to insights.

  • Orchestrate the analytics and insights experience across all US HCP engagement systems, as well as engage/consult with different stakeholders. To this end, the Dir, DCL will work to understand what is needed/required, what is feasible, and how omnichannel engagement leads, etc. can provide support.

Cross-functional Collaboration / Stakeholder Engagement

  • Collaborate with stakeholders and omnichannel engagement leads to understand the existing capabilities of current systems and vendors, including current data, metrics, and insights tracked and utilized by the team. Key stakeholders include MSLs, Med Comms, Pubs, Medical Information, and Strategy/Operations.

  • Key omnichannel engagement leads or other subject matter experts include CRM/CLM, Workfront Admin, Admin/Librarian, Web Admin/Takeda ID, and Insights Analysts.  Work with MSL/HCP Experience DCL to understand how best to share insights with MSLs/the field team, what insights MSLs/the field team require, and keep a pulse on the evolving needs of MSLs/the field team as resources and capabilities progress over time.

  • Support the Digital Engagement & Insights team in encouraging actions that are measurable and generate valuable insights.

  • Communicate with differing stakeholders across the Digital Engagement & Insights Team to effectively understand the broader content and digital engagement landscape.

  • Meet with, share, and implement best practices with parallel roles within the Medical Digital Engagement & Insights team.

  • Translate information coming from a variety of disparate sources to develop necessary insights, connections, and efficiencies. Understand which insights the team can generate, and the business needs to make sure they are aligned.

  • Operate in a matrixed environment and coordinate across functions, leading through influence.

Planning and Alignment

  • Oversee activities related to the implementation of data, modeling, and analytical plans.

  • Oversee the integration and classification of data from diverse sources, including engagement interaction data, clinical trials, electronic health records, insurance claims, patient registries, medical devices, etc.

  • Identify new/emerging opportunities and develop the business cases for investment.

  • Lead the documentation of existing and newly developed processes through the creation of playbooks and business requirements documents.

  • Develop and maintain a 2-3-year roadmap for engagement-related analytics and insights.

Career Development

  • As a line manager, oversee and evaluate employee contribution, performance, and development.

Internal Representation

  • Provide periodical updates to various teams, as well as provide visibility and clarity about status and ways forward.

Minimum Requirements/Qualifications:

Required:

  • Bachelor's Degree.

  • 6+ years of progressive experience in data management and governance and/or Commercial Sales Operations/Analytics experience with demonstrated ability to analyze, interpret, and explain systems and approaches for customer data and product data to enable business decisions.

  • 5+ years’ experience working in digital marketing operations, or marketing technology-related functions, with 3+ years of healthcare professional, leadership, and/or data-backed insight strategy experience.

  • Extensive experience with database querying (SQL), manipulating and analyzing large, high dimensional, structured and unstructured datasets

  • In-depth understanding and experience in utilizing the data/software development life-cycle management processes.

  • 2+ years’ experience working with cloud-computing technologies (e.g., Veeva, Adobe, AWS, Azure).

  • Comprehensive knowledge of ETL processes and digital platforms like Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics, Matomo, and Google Marketing Platform.

  • Comprehensive Knowledge of Master Data Management (MDM), data governance, and data quality business processes, solutions, and methodologies.

  • Experience leading data science projects through the data, analytics and machine learning lifecycle.

  • Excellent communication (oral, written, and presentation) and interpersonal skills

  • Strong planning and organization skills, attention to detail, execution, and follow-through.

  • Content process/approval experience.

Preferred:

  • Advanced Degree in any of the following fields: technical or analytical fields such as data science, statistics, operations research, industrial engineering, computer science, economics, math, etc.

  • Experience acting as a liaison with DD&T on data projects.

  • Experience with 3rd party pharmaceutical data like IQVIA (IMS Health) Sales Data (DDD, Xponent, NSP, NPA), Affiliation (HCOS), APLD (Medical Claims), and Specialty pharmacy data.

  • Experience with data analytics, digital dashboards, statistics, CPV etc.

  • Expertise with programming languages (e.g., Python, R, Julia etc.) and visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI, Looker Studio).

  • Experience working with data from any of the following sources and types: RWD, digital devices, imaging, audio, and/or operational data (finance, manufacturing, supply chain).

  • Project Management Professional (PMP)® or similar certification is preferred.

ABOUT THE ROLE:

A dynamic and visionary individual is sought to join our organization as a highly engaged member of the Commercial Operations and Business Solutions Organization.   As a key team member in COBS, the Senior Analyst, CRM Business Solutions will be engaged in transformative initiatives.   They will be an integral member of a culture that fosters continuous improvement, adaptability, and growth. The ability to effectively collaborate with stakeholders and COBS teammates, combined with problem-solving skills, and an enterprise mindset, will be paramount to success in this role. The ability to embrace change and desire to achieve organizational objectives is critical. Passion for growth, coupled with a desire to support our business, will be instrumental in shaping our future and ensuring its continued success in a rapidly evolving marketplace.

The Specialist, Field Platforms is responsible for establishing and maintaining excellence within the Customer Relationship Management System (CRM) for an assigned Therapeutic Area/Business Unit.

Product launch experience in the Life Sciences industry is particularly valuable, as well as the ability to act as a liaison, and effectively partner with key business stakeholders, IT implementation team, and other integrated stakeholder groups (Field Sales Reporting, MDM, Data Management, Marketing, Compliance, and Home Office Reporting).

This is primarily a business-facing (and user-facing) role, requiring the ability to build strong relationships and speak "business" and "technology" to the appropriate audiences. The ideal candidate will need the ability to identify gaps, know when to leverage technical expertise for execution, and focus on achieving functional goals.

Strong written and oral communications skills are a must, as is the ability to prioritize and manage multiple competing requests at once under potentially aggressive timelines.

ACCOUNTABILITIES

  • Responsible for the development, launch and continued improvement of the CRM Platform for respective business unit(s).
  • Develops accurate, complete requirements, transforming these potentially complex business “asks” into value- add business (system and process) solutions/capabilities.
  • Develops business unit specific plans/roadmaps, utilizing inputs from various sources (vendor metrics/KPIs, Field Surveys, and business unit contacts). Responsible for the measurement (KPIs) for these plans.
  • Serve as the primary escalation point and subject matter expert for issues and questions relating to CRM.  Uses deep knowledge and expertise of the respective systems to be able to effectively answer questions, provide support, and ensure quality and adoption.
  • Responsible for supporting the day to day CRM operational processes,ensuring quality CRM data and CRM functionality for assigned Business Unit(s). Responsible for identifying stakeholders, risks, opportunities (e.g. performance improvements) and make recommendations as needed.
  • Effectively manages vendor relationships, ensuring that timelines and data quality are maintained.
  • Executes UAT scripts for both the CRM platform, as well as overall Data Validation for CRM.
  • Creates documentation and training materials, and will conduct training for new hires, launches, and releases as needed.
  • Participates in two-way Vendor partnerships that result in increasing operational efficiencies and better services.
  • Actively engages in personal development plans and training to build expertise and achieve business objectives.
  • Embraces an agile mindset and spirit of innovation.

CORE ELEMENTS RELATED TO THIS ROLE

The individual must be self-motivated, a team player, have excellent verbal and written communication skills and possess the ability to manage simultaneous projects, prioritizing based on business criticality/needs.

Technical/Functional (Line) Expertise

  • Able to learn technical details of the administration, configuration, capabilities and management of Veeva CRM, and to obtain and retain a Veeva CRM Administrator certification (training will be provided)

Leadership

  • Building the ability to work across functions
  • Building the bility to present information clearly and with confidence with coaching/direction
  • Working to be a strong communicator, able to convey both ideas and data, verbally and in writing
  • Proven skills as an effective team player who can engender credibility and confidence within the team and with their stakeholders
  • Embraces and demonstrates a diversity and inclusion mindset and role models these behaviors for the organization

Decision-making and Autonomy

  • Has autonomy to make thoughtful decisions for their own work.
  • Ability to make decisions that impact their services
  • Accountable for decision making within their domain.  Engages the support of their manager as needed
  • Partakes in sharing input and collecting diverse input from multiple constituents and stakeholders to drive innovative solutions
  • Ability to incorporate feedback into decision making process

Interaction

  • Is begging to demonstrate solutions-oriented thinking
  • Supports a culture of performance, accountability, simplicity, empowerment, external orientation and curiosity.
  • Navigates the changing external and internal environment
  • Collaborates with business partners and is starting to demonstrate the ability to resolve conflict in a constructive manner
  • Ability to build partnerships with team members

Innovation

  • Comfortable bringing forward innovative solutions
  • Ability to suggest innovative solutions to improve their work
  • Building the ability to identify areas for process and systems innovation and suggest or implement change that will enhance the overall effectiveness of the team or service

  • Minimum of 3 years of experience in the pharmaceutical, immunology, biologic/biotech, or medical device industries.

At Takeda, we believe the pace of change has never been as fast as it is today. USA - MA - Cambridge

As the Rare and Rare-like franchises DD&T Program Manager, you will support and drive delivery of the portfolio of Data, Digital, and Technology initiatives aligned to enable the US Rare and Rare-like franchises Business Unit by ensuring that all contributing teams across Takeda as well as external partners are aligned and integrated into a cohesive program plan. Join Takeda as a Rare and Rare-like franchises DD&T Program Manager where you will range in size and complexity and will include work on commercial data and analytics solutions & platforms, field force technologies, as well as digital marketing enablement. Job Description

Director, Contract & Pricing Strategy, Insights & Solutions

Takeda Pharmaceutical

Exton, PA

About the role:

Are you looking for a patient-focused, innovation-driven company that will inspire you and empower you to shine? Join us as the Director, Contracts & Pricing (C&P) Strategy, Insights & Solutions in Exton, PA.  This position reports into the Vice President, Contracts and Pricing.

How you will contribute:

  • Develop and lead the creation of post-deal analytics and adherence initiatives for all channels in the USBU (e.g., Payer, GPO, IDN, trade, etc.) and provide quantitative analytical support to VP, Contracts & Pricing (C&P), Senior Director of Government Pricing, and Director of Reimbursement. Ensure all utilization processed by C&P is accurately captured by both Controller, for Gross to Net (GTN) accruals, and Price Forecasting Team, for business cases and planning (e.g., MRP, LBE, MYC and LRF).

  • Manage data quality, standards and guidelines; ensure data management governance within Contracts & Pricing systems to maintain data integrity and integration into Takeda’s DD&T initiatives (AI, Enterprise Data Backbone, Anaplan, master data management, etc.).

  • Work closely with the BUs and Managed Market leadership to monitor market conditions and changes in laws/regulations and educate C&P and Finance Business Partners on the implications of any such changes; Ensure Takeda’s strategies are operationally feasible and can effectively be executed by Contracts and Pricing.

  • Partner with commercial leaders (VPs and Directors) in the development of contract, pricing and rebate strategies that achieve favorable economic and strategic terms

  • Collaborate with Finance, Legal, Managed Markets and Value Strategy Leads to assess industry behaviors, legal rulings and government directives that may impacts contractual and reporting obligations

  • Lead cross functional projects (FMV valuations, legal entity standardization) to ensure consistency across channels and business units and incorporate legal, financial and customer implications.

  • Oversee and manage the development and implementation of reporting in order to track performance, commitment and customers adherence. Execute on high priority AI enterprise level initiatives and influence both Contracts & Pricing and the broader USBU to drive the evaluation and implementation of Takeda’s AI strategies.

  • Expand Contracts and Pricing’s use of cutting edge technologies and solutions by leveraging DD&T, third party providers and industry experts.

  • Represent C&P interest in Takeda’s overall technical initiatives that utilize Contracts and Pricing’s data, policies and resources Possess an in-depth industry knowledge and educate/influence business partners in Managed Markets, DD&T and the Business Units.

  • Share best practices across channels and business units to drive desired results from a products, IT, channel and customer perspective.

Minimum Requirements/Qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s degree minimum requirement, master’s degree preferred.

  • 10+ years of business experience, 5+ years at management level

  • 5+ years of progressive experience in one or more of the following areas: Marketing, Pricing, Contracts, Sales, or Finance in the pharmaceutical or healthcare industry

  • Experience in drafting and/or managing large volume and high dollar value agreements preferred

  • An understanding of various buying organizations; commercial, indirect customers, direct customers and government (Medicare Part D, 340B, Medicare Part B)

  • Strong understanding of Project Management, technology and systems

  • Proven track record of leading and driving business process transformation and organizational culture change as well as delivering on programs with complex business deliverables

  • Health care business acumen with a comprehensive understanding of the Pharmaceutical industry, specifically Managed Markets and Finance; Commercial and Medicare Part D market experience preferred

Job Description:
Job Description

About the role:

The MCM project leader will manage projects and change control for material changes/implementation (raw material, auxiliaries, excipients, and packaging) for all impacted manufacturing sites, ensuring supply continuity and business growth. You will coordinate raw materials implementation for products while balancing plant efficiency, sales, distribution, customer service, while meeting inventory, manufacturing, quality and regulatory requirements. This is a full-time role reporting to the Director of Supply Chain in Social Circle, GA.

How you will contribute:

Address controversial Supply Chain factors and needs (Supply Planning, Demand Planning, Strategic Sourcing & Supplier Management) in the context of material change to one Supply Chain implementation strategy process; lead projects with different levels of complexity affecting multiple sites and products.

  • Manage projects for raw material changes (Supplier Notifications of Change, Material Change Requests, Decommissioning and Product Exits) for all products/plants considering lowest possible impact on market supply and manufacturing operations while still maintaining highest possible efficiency in change implementation.
  • Lead cross-divisional projects with a broad scope: Identify and engage necessary resources. Identify barriers and recommend solutions. Develop a project plan and implement to timeline. Communicate project status to requestors, customers and senior management.
  • Define implementation plan and mitigation strategy based on supply/demand forecast. Optimize inventory levels with Supply Planning to reduce the financial impact of the change while securing the launch of new material.
  • Align different Supply Chain views and requirements in the context of material change to the implementation strategy.
  • Lead global teams in defining strategies, developing goals, assigning project tasks and ensure the team meets all goals.
  • Analyze complex data with the understanding of trade-offs between different business objectives and present recommendations; ensure globally harmonized application of raw material implementation processes across the different functions and facilities
  • Manage process performance of material changes; define and control transparent process for business case development of requested material changes as base for definition of project priority and required implementation target date.
  • Process understanding and improvement, and establish and maintain relationships with customers (sites), partners, third parties/vendors.
  • Initiate escalation processes and facilitate problem resolution for issues endangering supply continuity or fulfillment of business-critical goals.

What You Bring to Takeda:

Education and Experience Requirements

  • High School Diploma or GED plus 4+ years of related experience OR Bachelor's degree in science, engineering, business, operations, Supply Chain or other related technical field. and some related experience.
  • Project Management, Change Control, Supply Chain, Materials Management knowledge. People Management per experience and education
  • IT: ERP systems (C3ME or others), EQM systems (e.g. TrackWise, Saba), project management tools, MS Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, SharePoint)
  • Interaction with team members of different origin and multiple locations; focus on continuous improvement.
  • Prefer experience working in an FDA regulated environment.

Physical Requirements

  • Must be able to lift up to 30 lbs.
  • Frequently or constantly lift, carry push, pull, or move objects and repetitive motions.
  • You will have a combination of sedentary work and walking around the facility.
  • Prolonged periods sitting at a desk and working on a computer.
  • Work is performed in an office setting.
  • Subject to inside environmental conditions.
  • Travel for this position will include less than 5% locally usually for training purposes.
  • Can work off hours.
  • May enter controlled environments requiring special gowning.
  • No makeup, no jewelry, contact lenses, nail polish, artificial fingernails maybe worn in the manufacturing environment

Important Considerations

At Takeda, our patients rely on us to create quality products and we aim to create a safe environment for our team members. As a result, we must follow strict rules in our manufacturing facilities to ensure we are not endangering the quality of the product or putting anyone at the site in harm's way. You may:

  • Work in a controlled environment requiring special gowning and wear protective clothing over the head, face, hands, feet and body. This may include additional hearing protection for loud areas.
  • Need to remove all make-up, jewelry, contact lenses, nail polish and artificial fingernails while in the manufacturing environment.
  • Work in a cold, wet environment.
  • Work multiple shifts, including weekends, or be asked to work supplemental hours, as necessary.
  • Work around chemicals such as alcohol, acids, buffers and Celite that may require respiratory protection.

At Takeda, we are transforming patient care through the development of novel specialty pharmaceuticals and best in class patient support programs. Takeda is a patient-focused company to inspire and empower you to grow through life-changing work.

Certified as a Global Top Employer, Takeda offers stimulating careers, encourages innovation, and strives for excellence in everything we do. We foster an inclusive, collaborative workplace, in which our teams are united by an unwavering commitment to deliver Better Health and a Brighter Future to people around the world.

Job Description

Associate Director of Brand Capabilities

Takeda Pharmaceutical

Cambridge, MA or Lexington, MA

About the role:

A dynamic and visionary individual is sought to join our organization as a highly engaged member of the Commercial Operations and Business Solutions (COBS) team within Commercial Learning and Development (CL&D) during a time of significant change.  The Associate Director of Brand Capabilities will play a crucial role in driving and navigating transformative initiatives while fostering a culture of continuous improvement, adaptability, and growth. The ability to effectively communicate and collaborate with stakeholders at all levels, combined with strategic thinking and exceptional problem-solving skills, and an enterprise mindset, will be paramount to success in this role. Strong leadership will be required to inspire and motivate teams to embrace change and achieve organizational objectives.  Passion for innovation, coupled with experience, will be instrumental in shaping our future and ensuring its continued success in a rapidly evolving marketplace.

As an Associate Director of Brand Capabilities, you will work closely with various levels of brand leadership from Sr. Product Managers through Franchise heads, as well as partner closely with cross-functional partners such as Analytics & Insights, Managed Markets, Patient Services etc. The mission of the team is to Serve as a strategic partner and business enabler that leverages expertise to provide capabilities development and business solutions to deliver a competitive advantage and unlock the greatest potential of our brands in support of our patients. This team plays an important role within the organization for advancing core competencies as well as identifying and developing next generation capabilities. This is a unique opportunity for an experienced marketer who has a passion for partnering to advance strategic know-how and to influence patient outcomes.

How you will contribute:

  • Partner and advise marketing, brand, and launch teams and their cross functional partners on marketing capabilities such as Product Positioning, Insights Generation, Brand Planning, Customer Engagement and Measurement

  • Identify capability and learning needs with brand partners and facilitate connections and sharing of best practices across the USBU.

  • Work directly with launch teams to develop the needed capabilities and business outputs for launch.

  • Parlay marketing subject matter expertise into a learning environment by identifying new learning modalities, creating curriculum and upskilling the Takeda commercial community

  • Identify future competency and capability development opportunities with brand partners

  • Collaborate and support the ongoing development and execution of the brand capabilities roadmap

  • Influence and foster change management elements through initiatives such as community of practice, communications, best practice sharing etc.
